item.title: Lee add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Lee add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Lee add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Lee add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "But this I know; the writer who possesses the creative gift owns something of which he is not always master--something that at times strangely wills and works for itself. He may lay down rules and devise principles, and to rules and principles it will perhaps for years lie in subjection; and then, haply without any warning of revolt, there comes a time when it will no longer consent." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Lee add a quote by Basho Matsuo
item.description: "Winter solitude- in a world of one colour the sound of the wind." -- Basho Matsuo

item.title: Lee add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "PHOSPHORESCENCE. Now there's a word to lift your hat to... to find that phosphorescence, that light within, that's the genius behind poetry." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lee add a quote by Arthur Rimbaud
item.description: "I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still." -- Arthur Rimbaud

item.title: Lee add a quote by C.D. Wright
item.description: "I am suggesting that the radical of poetry lies not in the resolution of doubts but in their proliferation" -- C.D. Wright
